Description: Glazed composition shabti of Horiraa with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief holding two incised hoes and the string of the seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder, the legs are inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in seven rows of incised Hieroglyphs unseparated by lines; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 54 [24].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
